TopicTitle: Symmetry issue after exporting file from SPH to VAB

Articles.Content:
I'm having symmetry after I exported a craft file from SPH to VAB, I change SPH to VAB in the 2 lines of the craft files but i still have issues

Does anyone knows why?

Edited April 22, 2014 by edemlama

The 'official' way of moving your creations between SPH and VAB is subassemblies. You won't run into such problems if you use these.

Your problem is that your root part is placed horizontally. Put your rover vertically, make an L-shaped "adapter" to have the rocket vertical as well, then it will work. When you're done remove the adapter and stick the rover to the rocket the originally intended way.

The 'official' way of moving your creations between SPH and VAB is subassemblies. You won't run into such problems if you use these.

Your problem is that your root part is placed horizontally. Put your rover vertically, make an L-shaped "adapter" to have the rocket vertical as well, then it will work. When you're done remove the adapter and stick the rover to the rocket the originally intended way.

my root part is the first one,is that correct? Can I just change it with the same one from the VAB?
There's a mod out there called Root Select and that should allow you to change the root part of your ship. But I cannot provide any more info as I don't use mods.
thank you!!! you were of great help!!!
